abstract: Industrial and Commercial Bank of China, the largest bank by market value, said Tuesday that it would seek to buy back the 27 percent of a Hong Kong-listed subsidiary that it doesn’t already own for about $1.4 billion.
snippet: Industrial and Commercial Bank of China, the largest bank by market value, said Tuesday that it would seek to buy back the 27 percent of a Hong Kong-listed subsidiary that it doesn’t already own for about $1.4 billion.
lead_paragraph: Industrial and Commercial Bank of China, the largest bank in the world by market value, said Tuesday that it would seek to buy back, for about $1.4 billion,  the 27 percent of a Hong Kong-listed subsidiary that it doesn’t already own.

headline.main: I.C.B.C. Bids $1.4 Billion for Hong Kong Unit

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Industrial and Commercial Bank of China
